title: fmt: Sscanf says 'bad verb %%' for format string '%d%'
body:
`fmt.Printf("%d%", 42)` gives `42%!(NOVERB)`, spotting the percent with no following verb.
`fmt.Sscanf("42 314", "%d%", &i, &j)` with ints i and j returns an error of `bad verb %% for integer`.

No `%%` occurs in the format specifier.â€‚The cause is parsenum() winding back from being at the end of the string, having processed the second `%`, to just before it so it's used as the verb in the error.
